intro: Dianthus hungaricus, commonly known as the Hungarian carnation, is a flowering plant native to the Carpathian Basin. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red petals that resemble those of the carnation. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–40 cm and features upright stems with clustered flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Dianthus hungaricus is also valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional herbal medicine.
